author: Slidebean
description:
U.S. sanctions didn’t stop China’s AI, they split it in two.

U.S. sanctions were meant to slow China’s AI progress.
Instead, they forced it to fight on two fronts at once.

On one side, giants like ByteDance are going wide:
embedding smaller, cheaper AI into video, search, and consumer platforms to drive scale and revenue fast.

On the other side, labs like DeepSeek are going deep:
facing chip shortages, they’re forced to squeeze every ounce of performance out of limited hardware to chase frontier breakthroughs through algorithmic efficiency.

This isn’t just strategy, it’s a response to compute scarcity.
China is building two parallel AI ecosystems:
one for cutting edge research, and one for everyday use at massive scale.

👉 Visit our YouTube channel for more content.
title: Sanctions didn’t slow China’s AI. They changed how it wins
